main event: A simultaneous sighting of three unidentified flying objects was reported on April 27, 1956, in Greensboro, North Carolina.
interesting points: The first object was a bright silver object that darted diagonally in the sky without making any sound or leaving a tail, The witnesses initially thought it was a shooting star but dismissed the idea due to its size and lack of a tail, The second sighting involved two copper-colored objects flying in parallel, The sizes of the objects varied, with one being about the size of a vanilla wafer and the other larger, The sighting was made under exceptionally clear skies at night, enhancing visibility.
sighted object: one bright silver object and two copper-colored objects
witness description: two women, one nearsighted and the other extremely farsighted, visiting a mutual friend
